isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3600, 3800, 4000FBC - CAB ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Measure voltage to ground at (J1) (Body Builder Feed Stud).
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14D (14 with 3600), then repair.
At fuse D3 circuit 14A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 14A, then repair.
Remove fuse F3 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace defective fuse.
Remove relay (61) and re-install fuse F3. At relay socket (61), measure voltage from circuit 85 to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 85, then repair.
At relay socket (61), measure voltage from circuit 85B to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 85B, then repair.
Bench test horn relay (61) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test horn relay (61) by applying +12 volts to pin 85, ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
With horn button depressed, at relay socket (61) measure voltage between circuits 85 and 85A.
Locate cause of open or poor connection in horn control circuit between relay and horn button ground, then repair.
At relay socket (61) use a test lead to jumper circuit 85 to 85C.
With jumper still in place, disconnect connector (2) and measure voltage from circuit 85C [going to (61)] to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 85C, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (2), disconnect conn. (425), and with jumper still in place, measure voltage from circuit 85C [going to (2)] to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 85C, then repair.
At conn. (425), with jumper still in place, measure voltage from circuit 85C to 11-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GB/ 11-GJ to starter ground, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (425), disconnect conn. (605), at circuit 85C with jumper still in place, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 85C, then repair.
At conn. (605), with jumper still in place, measure voltage from circuit 85C to 85-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 85-G/ 11-GB, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (605) and at high note horn, measure resistance from circuit 85-GA to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 85-GA/ 85-G, then repair.
At high note horn, with jumper still place, measure voltage from circuit 85C to 85-GA.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 85C/85B, then repair.
High note horn circuits check good. Does horn sound?
At low note horn, measure resistance from circuit 85-GB to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 85-GB, then repair.
At low note horn, with jumper still in place, measure voltage from circuit 85D to 85-GB.
Locate cause of not or low voltage in circuit 85D, then repair.
Low note horn circuits check good. Does horn sound?
Horn cir. check good. Remove test jumper and re-install relay (61).
Remove fuse C3 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse C3 and at circuit 14A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair.
Remove flasher from conn. (1) and measure voltage from circuit 55 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 55, then repair.
At conn. (1) install a test jumper from circuit 55 to 55A/60. Disconnect turn signal switch conn. (193) and measure voltage from circuit 55A/60 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 55A/60, then repair.
Move turn signal switch to left turn position and at (193), measure resistance from orange/black wire to orange/violet wire.
With switch still in left turn position and at (193), measure resistance from orange/black wire to orange/yellow wire.
Move switch to right turn position and at (193), measure resistance from orange/black wire to orange/gray wire.
With switch in right turn position, at (193) measure resistance from orange/black wire to orange/red wire.
Reconnect conn. (193). Does left front turn light function properly?
Disconnect front end conn. (413) [(526) w/3600]. At (413) or (526) circuit 56A and with switch in left turn position, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56A, dash connector (2), or circuit 56, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (413) or (526) and disconnect turn signal conn. (503). At circuit 56A with turn signal switch in left turn position, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56A, then repair.
At conn. (503) measure voltage from circuit 56A to 11-GD with turn signal switch in left turn position.
Locate open or poor connection in ground path, circuit 11-GD, 11-GC/ 11-GB, conn. (425) [(526) w/3600], or cir. 11-GB/ 11-GJ (11-GG/ 11-GB/ 11-GJ w/3600), then repair.
Circuits to left front turn light check good. Reconnect all connectors. Does light function properly?
Does the right front turn light function properly?
Disconnect conn. (413) [(5260 w/3600]. At (413) or (526) circuit 57A and with switch in right turn position, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57A, dash connector (2) or circuit 57, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (413) or (526), disconnect turn signal conn. (505) and at circuit 57A with turn signal switch in right turn position, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57A, then repair.
At conn. (505), measure voltage from circuit 57A to 11-GF with turn signal switch in right turn position.
Locate open or poor connection in ground path, circuits 11-GF, 11-GE/ 11-GB, conn. (425) [(526) w/3600], or cir. 11-GB/ 11-GJ (cir. 11-GG/ 11-GB/ 11-GJ w/3600), then repair.
Circuits to right front turn light check good. Reconnect all connectors. Does light function properly?
At body builder conn. (194), measure voltage from circuit 56D to gnd. with turn signal switch in left turn position.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56D, then repair.
At conn. (194) measure voltage from circuit 57D to ground with turn signal switch in right turn position.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57D, then repair.
Remove test jumper and re-install turn signal flasher. Do the body builder lights flash when turn signal switch is moved to a turn position?
Stop, tail, turn, and hazard signal light circuits check good.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signal Circuitry With Dual Face Lights

table.title: Turn Signal Circuitry With Dual Face Lights

entry.para: Remove fuse C3 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse C3 and at circuit 14A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A, then repair.
Remove flasher from conn. (1) and measure voltage from circuit 55 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 55, then repair.
At conn. (1) install a test jumper from circuit 55 to 55A/60. Disconnect turn signal switch conn. (193) and measure voltage from circuit 55A/60 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 55A/60, then repair.
Move turn signal switch to left turn position and at (193), measure resistance from orange/black wire to orange/violet wire.
With switch still in left turn position and at (193), measure resistance from orange/black wire to orange/yellow wire.
Move switch to right turn position and at (193), measure resistance from orange/black wire to orange/gray wire.
With switch in right turn position, at (193) measure resistance from orange/black wire to orange/red wire.
Reconnect conn. (193). Does left front turn light function properly?
Disconnect front end conn. (413) [(526) w/3600]. At (413) or (526) circuit 56A and with switch in left turn position, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56A, dash connector (2), or circuit 56, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (413) or (526) and disconnect turn signal conn. (503). At circuit 56A with turn signal switch in left turn position, measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56A/56, then repair.
At conn. (503) measure voltage from circuit 56A to 11-GD with turn signal switch in left turn position.
Locate open or poor connection in ground path, circuit 11-GC, 11-GG/ 11-GB, conn. (425) [(526) w/3600], or circuit 11-GB/ 11-GJ (11-GG/ 11-GB/ 11-GJ w/3600), then repair.
Circuits to left front turn light check good. Reconnect all connectors. Does light function properly?
Does the left dual face/pedestal light function properly?
Disconnect turn signal conn. (508) and with turn signal switch in left turn position, measure voltage from circuit 56F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56F, then repair.
At conn. (508) and with turn signal switch in left turn position, measure voltage from circuit 56F to 11-GG.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GG, then repair.
Circuits to left dual face/pedestal light check good. Reconnect all connectors. Does light function properly?
Does the right front turn light function properly?
Disconnect conn. (413) [(526) w/3600]. At (413) or (526) circuit 57A and with switch in right turn position, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57A, dash connector (2), or circuit 57, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (413) or (526), disconnect turn signal conn. (505) and at circuit 57A with turn signal switch in right turn position, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57A, then repair.
At conn. (505), measure voltage from circuit 57A to 11-GF with turn signal switch in right turn position.
Locate open or poor connection in ground path, cir. 11-GF, 11-GE/ 11-GB, conn. (425) [(526) w/3600], or cir. 11-GB/ 11-GJ (cir. 11-GG/ 11-GB/ 11-GJ with 3600), then repair.
Circuits to right front turn light check good. Reconnect all connectors. Does light function properly?
Does the right dual face/pedestal light function properly?
Disconnect turn signal conn. (509) and with turn signal switch in right turn position, measure voltage from circuit 57F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57F, then repair.
At connector (509) and with turn signal switch in right turn position, measure voltage from circuit 57F to 11-GH.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GH, then repair.
Circuits to right dual face/pedestal light check good. Reconnect all connectors. Does light function properly?
At body builder conn. (194) (disconnect if necessary), measure voltage from circuit 56D to ground with turn signal switch in left turn position.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56D, then repair.
At conn. (194) measure voltage from circuit 57D to ground with turn signal switch in right turn position.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57D, then repair.
Remove test jumper and re-install turn signal flasher. Do the body builder lights flash when turn signal switch is moved to a turn position?
Stop, tail, turn, and hazard signal light circuits check good.
